pros: - great part-time opportunity if you're a student - lots of room to grow and you get to know with the professors also! - work load is shared with other tutors at the center
cons: - the pay is not as high as with that of private tutors (which makes sense because the workload and pressure isn't as high too)

review_title: Reflections on Working as an IT Helpdesk Support Representative at Pasadena City College
job_title: IT Helpdesk Support in Pasadena, CA
pros: I recently worked as an IT helpdesk support representative for Pasadena City College, and I have to say that overall it was a great experience. Pasadena City College had a strong focus on customer service, and I always felt like my main priority was to help our faculty and staff resolve their technical issues as quickly and effectively as possible.
cons: Potential challenge of working in an IT helpdesk support position is that it can sometimes be frustrating when clients are resistant to following troubleshooting steps or implementing solutions that may require them to change their workflow or habits. While it's important to maintain a positive and professional attitude in these situations, it can be difficult to keep morale up when clients are uncooperative or dismissive of the helpdesk's recommendations. However, this is a common issue in many customer service roles and can be mitigated through effective communication and a strong focus on problem-solving.

review_title: Sadly Not What It Used To Be
pros: Diverse student body. Some great resources and departments. Insurance Benefits are very good.
cons: Human Resources has allowed many individuals to be hired who lack professionalism and competency. Even within the HR Office, I have received numerous emails with typos and information delivered in a manner that makes obvious that there is not an understanding of terminology and policies. The college has gone from a stellar institute to one where you can still find staff that are efficient but the majority do not belong in an institution for higher education. Salary less than other community colleges in So Cal.

pros: Caring staff Flexible Scheduling Excellent management
cons: Pay was at or a bit above minimum wage.

review_title: PCC is a great institution with even greater potential.
pros: Faculty and staff are student driven and go over and beyond to ensure that the students are well taken care of.
cons:
-Part-time employees are only allowed to work 900 hours a year or 170 days - whichever comes first. 

-No one advocated for hourly employees (no unions). 

-Hourly employees have not received any compensation for working during the pandemic, providing proof of vaccination, or getting the booster shot while full time employees and students did.

pros: I got trained a tutor in weekly 1-hour classes. The environment was very welcoming and friendly. The work is low stress, low pressure, perfect to do part-time while going to school. And you meet a lot of new people there!
cons: Scheduling, depending on the subject you're tutoring, can be difficult. I was a statistics tutor, so I always got 20 hours a week. But English tutors had to really fight for it.

pros: It's a nice campus to teach / work as an adjunct. Students are relatively more serious about learning. Get paid a small stipend for office hours. It's an awesome side gig for someone with a full time job / health benefit to earn extra bucks. Also as added benefit, part timers are able to earn a life time pension, albeit the many classes / years you have to you put in will take a long time.
cons: Pay is relative low compare to other community colleges in the area (pay schedules are published, so you don't really need Glass Door to tell ya). Can be terrible if you are doing part time job as your full time job given the low pay.

review_title: Part Time Student and Employee for 2 years
job_title: Photo Lab Operator in Pasadena, CA
pros: Depending on which department you're working at, it can be fun and exciting. You meet different people, interact, and the better you do your job, the more they begin to acknowledge you (the students and some staff).  Can be a very friendly atmosphere.
cons: Right before I left due to transferring to another school far away, the employees (the higher ups) began acting suspicious.  We also had a change of authority in more places than one. Something we weren't too happy about due to the history of these two people in general. The way that my former boss treated us was in a nutshell saying, "I'm going to make your life here harder and hope that you quit on your own so I can fill these positions with my own little puppets."  Ever since then, it's gone downhill.

pros: Always willing to try something new to help students
cons: Some communication issues amidst fast pace changes.

pros: a large school with many offerings
cons: Do not value their adjunct staff

pros: Good direct management. They allow for personal time, and it's not a job where you have to sweat in order to complete the day. In fact, many people just glide through doing next to nothing.
cons: If you like being bored out of your mind, then work at PCC. Also, be prepared to be frustrated. At home, most of us are used to good technology, and we're used to companies trying to expand their technology to entice new clients. At PCC their technology is a joke. They're back in the 80's at best. Their MIS department is horrendous. They are undereducated and next to worthless.

review_title: Poor Leadership and No Concern for non-Union or Part Time Staff
pros:
-Valuable Work Experience 
-Depending on Department Leadership, can be flexible schedule
cons:
-Incredibly toxic work culture
-Depending on Department, complete disregard for your wellbeing
-Hard-cap on hours that supervisors will push you over, meaning you can work hours and not get paid for them
-Disinterested Human Resources Office that will always assume the worst of you.
-Non-union workers are seen as disposable.

pros: The opportunity to make a positive impact on students; to teach and inspire them in their accounting studies; to make students understand that solid accounting knowledge will benefit them in all aspects of their lives and careers.  Each class provides me with the opportunity to also learn from students and improve my teaching abilities.
cons: There needs to be better standardization in the accounting curriculum among classes.  I tested students every 2 chapters to ensure they understood materials.  Other professors did not as it is a lot of work.  It would be better for students to have a somewhat consistent syllabus among all classes.

review_title: This employment was definitely a laid back experience; Having even a minimal amount of competency is sufficient.
pros: A major benefit is definitely the incredibly flexible schedule (although that may vary depending on who manages your department).  The pay is reasonable; Nothing more should be expected from a student-worker position at a college.
cons: The downsides, (although almost every student-worker job has this downside attached to it) are that there is no possibility of career advancement and there is no chance of receiving benefits and/or a pay raise.

job_title: College Assistant II in Pasadena, CA
pros: People in different departments usually get along quite well. It's very funny to interact and observe professors besides simply being a student and in the classroom. Good discounts if you show your staff IDs around and nearby the school
cons: Pay raises are few and in between. Lack of training. Dealing with irate parents and students can be draining. Not enough hours for employees due to constant budget cuts. Not many chances to climb the promotion ladder.

pros: Plenty of Opportunity. The institution is large enough to find some type of employment to start, then able to move laterally within the school.
cons: At the mercy of external forces.... state and federal funding will always be an issue when working for a California Community College. With that said, job security may forever be an issue.... or a blessing depending on how the economy holds up.

review_title: Great place to get teaching experience
pros: The staff and administration in my department were outstanding. PCC has a beautiful campus, especially for a community college, and I always enjoyed spending time there. They were extremely flexible in helping me create a schedule that worked.
cons: Well, everyone knows it's difficult to make a living as an adjunct. That's no different at PCC. Yes, the hourly pay rates are good, but you can only get so many hours. They have very strict rules about that. No benefits aside from a fairly insignificant retirement program.

review_title: Great environment to work and flexible working schedule
pros: I am an accounting tutor, and the best thing to work is I can learn/review accounting concept as I teach people
cons: The wage is minimum wage, but will have promotion if we achieve the tutor training
